document.masterDocTitle: Predatory mites from crops and pastures in South Africa: potential natural enemies of redlegged earth mite Halotydeus destructor (Acari: Penthaleidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Predatory mites from crops and pastures in South Africa: potential natural enemies of redlegged earth mite Halotydeus destructor (Acari: Penthaleidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype female, Hermanus,
28 .viii. 1994
, T. K. Qin, clover and weeds, site 30­31 (=
94 ­ 31
). Paratypes ,
1 female
, same data as holotype ;
4 females
,
2 males
, Humansdorp,
18 .viii. 1994
, T. K. Qin, clover and weeds, site 30 – 14 (=
94 ­ 14
);
8 females
,
3 males
, 42 km north of Cape Town, Kalbaskraal turnoff,
25 .viii. 1994
, grass and vetch, site 30 – 30 (=
94 ­ 30 ).

Legs . Chaetotaxy: Leg I: coxa 0 0/ 1 0/ 1 0; trochanter 1 1 / 1 0/ 2 1 ; femur 2 3 / 1 2 / 3 2 ; genu 2 3 / 2 3 / 1 2 ; tibia 2 3 / 2 3 / 2 2 . Leg II: coxa 0 0/ 1 0/ 1 0; trochanter 1 0/ 1 0/ 2 1 ; femur 2 3 / 1 2 / 2 1 ; genu 2 3 / 1 2 / 1 2 ; tibia 2 2 / 1 2 / 1 2 ; tarsus 3 3 / 2 3 / 2 3 + mv , md . Leg III: coxa 0 0/ 1 0/ 1 0; trochanter 1 0/ 1 0/ 2 1 ; femur 1 2 / 1 2 /0 0; genu 2 2 / 1 2 /0 1 ; tibia 2 1 / 1 2 / 1 1 ; tarsus 3 3 / 2 3 / 2 3 + mv , md . Leg IV: coxa 0 0/ 1 0/0 0; trochanter 1 0/ 1 0/ 2 1 ; femur 1 2 / 1 2 /0 0; genu 2 2 /0 3 / 1 1 ; tibia 2 1 / 1 3 / 1 2 ; tarsus 3 3 / 2 3 / 2 3 + mv , md . All leg setae fine, smooth pointed. All tarsi with a pair of claws and a rounded membranous pulvillus projecting slightly beyond the claws.
Dorsal idiosoma . Dorsal shield length 676–727 µm, width 412–458 µm (n= 5 ), structure and chaetotaxy as for female.

Gnathosoma
. As for female except fixed digit of chelicera with a small distal tooth, a small tooth adjacent to the pilus dentilis, and three large proximal teeth; movable digit with a single medial tooth, spermatodactyl fused with movable digit for most of its length, with a robust distal projection extending slightly beyond the tip of the movable digit, arthrodial brush modified into a membranous flap (
Fig. 35
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 29–33 .
Gamasiphoides lootsi
sp. nov. , female. 29. dorsal idiosoma; 30. ventral idiosoma; 31. epistome; 32. chelicera; 33. hypostome. Scale bar = 100 µm for 29, 30, 60 µm for 31, 32, 33.

subSubSection.paragraph:
In the key to species of
Gamasiphoides
given by
Karg ( 1993 b)
,
G. lootsi
runs to
G. octosetae
Karg 1976
, on the basis of the shape of the ventri­anal shield (length = width), short dorsal shield setae, shape of the epistome, and the presence of 8 pairs of setae on the ventri­anal shield. However, G. l o o t s i differs from G. o c t o s e t a e in having sternal shield setae st 1 and st 2 smooth and pointed (pilose in G. o c t o s e t a e ). The leg chaetotaxy of
G. lootsi
agrees with that for African species of
Gamasiphoides
described by
Lee ( 1970 )
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 34–36 .
Gamasiphoides lootsi
sp. nov. , male. 34. sterniti­genital shield; 35. chelicera; 36. femur, genu, and tibia of leg II. Scale bar = 100 µm for 34, 80 µm for 35, 36.

subSubSection.paragraph: This species is named in honour of South African acarologist Dr G. C. Loots.
